anomalies.message: [ESCALATE] Signature is present. High Random Forest (78.8%) and XGBoost (79.0%) sub-model scores combined with a missing written-amount field trigger an elevated risk.

ai_analysis.summary: Signature is present. High Random Forest (78.8%) and XGBoost (79.0%) sub-model scores combined with a missing written-amount field trigger an elevated risk.
reasoning: The overall ensemble fraud score reports 0.0% with 0% confidence, but both RF and XGB sub-models independently flag ~79% risk, indicating conflicting model behavior that merits human review.
Written-amount field is “Unknown,” which aligns with training data showing 45% of fraud cases involve amount mismatches or omissions.
New customer with no transaction history provides no behavioral baseline; new-customer status is a common trait in high-risk cases in our database.
No similar past cases to reference, so automated thresholds alone aren’t sufficient for approval.
Document date and location appear plausible, but missing written amount prevents full consistency checks.
actionable_recommendations: Request the customer or issuer to provide the filled-in written amount.
Ask the customer for a valid photo ID and compare signature samples.
Physically examine the money order for security features and vendor stamps.
